event.title: defined by the United States Census Bureau in 2003

data.event: Marion is the county's largest city and the center of the Marion Micropolitan Statistical Area (as defined by the United States Census Bureau in 2003).

event.title: 1812 when Jacob Foos, a surveyor for General Harrison's army, discovered

data.event: The origins of Marion can be traced back to the War of 1812 when Jacob Foos, a surveyor for General Harrison's army, discovered a spring at the top of a hill and established a well there which was named "Jacob's Well".

event.title: the middle of the night Foos

data.event: Legend has it that in the middle of the night Foos awoke with a terrible thirst.

event.title: was located near what is now

data.event: This well was located near what is now Marion Towers on Delaware Ave.
Marion County was officially recognized in 1824.
